meanings.definition: The quality of being flavorful or tasty.
meanings.sent1: The savorinesses of the soup made everyone smile.
meanings.sent2: I love the savorinesses of a well-seasoned steak.
meanings.sent3: The savorinesses of the cake were so good, it disappeared in minutes.
meanings.sent4: Her cooking always has a touch of savorinesses that warms the heart.
meanings.sent5: The savorinesses of the stew lingered on my taste buds long after dinner.

meanings.definition: The enjoyment or appreciation of delicious food.
meanings.sent1: His face lit up with savorinesses as he took the first bite.
meanings.sent2: We shared stories and savorinesses over a delightful meal.
meanings.sent3: The savorinesses of the feast were so delightful, we couldn't stop eating.
meanings.sent4: In her eyes, savorinesses were the key to a happy heart.
meanings.sent5: The savorinesses of the dish brought back memories of childhood meals.

meanings.definition: The essence of deliciousness in a dish.
meanings.sent1: The chef's secret ingredient added savorinesses to the sauce.
meanings.sent2: The savorinesses of the curry were unmatched by any other dish.
meanings.sent3: As she tasted the savorinesses, she knew this was a recipe worth keeping.
meanings.sent4: The savorinesses of the pie filled the room with a comforting aroma.
meanings.sent5: With each bite, the savorinesses of the lasagna transported him to Italy.
